Warga Australia Simpan Burger McDonald’s Hampir 25 Tahun Dan Tetap Utuh
05 Nov 2019, 06:31 by ABC
Rekor burger McDonald's tertua tak lagi dipegang Eslandia. Dua pria dari Australia mengklaim memiliki burger waralaba makanan cepat saji itu dengan usai hampir seperempat abad.
Poin Utama Burger McD
Poin utama
• Burger quarter pounder ini memiliki halaman Facebook sendiri dan pernah memiliki profil Tinder
• McDonald's menutup tiga cabangnya di Islandia pada 2009, menjadikannya satu-satunya negara Barat tanpa gerai McDonald's
• Ahli gizi mengatakan kandungan garam yang tinggi dan kelembaban yang rendah di atmosfer bisa mencegah pembusukan
Burger -yang dipamerkan dalam kaca sebagai "cheeseburger terakhir McDonald's yang dijual di Islandia" -ini menjadi sensasi internet saat merayakan ulang tahunnya yang ke-10 pada hari Jumat (1/11/2019).
Ribuan netizen telah mengikuti proses penuaan burger ini, sementara banyak turis berpose selfie dengan burger ini dan kentang gorengnya yang dipajang seperti karya seni di dalam wadah kaca di hostel Snotra House di Islandia.
Bukan rekor yang jelek, tetapi ternyata rekor yang jauh lebih tua ada di Australia. Warga Australia, Casey Dean dan Eduard Nits, mengatakan mereka masih memiliki burger quarter pounder yang akan berusia 25 tahun.
"Saya pikir mereka akan kesulitan mengejar usia burger kami, tetapi semoga mereka berhasil," kata Dean ketika ditanya tentang burger Islandia itu.

External Link: 
Took the little guy out for some fresh air today... and for an interview in front of 113 million Russian viewers.

Di tahun 1995, kedua sahabat itu membeli burger di salah satu gerai McDonald's di Adelaide.


Casey Dean dan Eduard Nits membeli quarter pounder ketika mereka masih remaja. Supplied; Cassey Dean

Makanan cepat saji adalah makanan yang jarang dimakan oleh anak-anak berusia 14 tahun itu, jadi Dean mengatakan waktu itu mereka membeli "burger McDonald's dalam jumlah yang konyol karena kami bisa membelinya".
Dengan satu burger yang tersisa, seorang teman dari negara bagian lain yang tadinya hendak datang berkunjung mengatakan, "Simpan burgernya untukku sampai aku kembali".
"Ia tak pernah kembali jadi kami masih punya burger itu," ujar Dean, pemilik burger puluhan tahun itu kepada ABC.


Dean dan Nits mengatakan awalnya tindakan mereka hanyalah lelucon. Supplied; Cassey Dean

Apa yang dimulai sebagai lelucon pribadi, dan sesuatu untuk "mengejutkan" teman-teman mereka, menjadi tenar di seluruh dunia pada tahun 2015 setelah pasangan teman ini menemukan burger itu, yang ternyata tersimpan di belakang gudang saudara perempuan Nits, dengan penampakan yang masih sama persis seperti 20 tahun sebelumnya.
"Wujudnya sekeras batu," kata Dean, seraya menambahkan bahwa bruger itu tak pernah berbau sama sekali.
"Masih terlihat sama tetapi itu seperti batu bata. Anda bisa menumbangkan seseorang dengannya."
Kini dikenal sebagai "burger senior", makanan cepat saji ini memiliki akun Facebook sendiri bernama 'Bisakah Burger Berusia 20 Tahun Ini Mendapatkan Lebih Banyak Like Daripada Kanye West?' dan sebuah lagu berjudul 'Bebaskan Burgernya' yang berisi tentang burger itu sendiri.
Burger yang berusia hampir 25 tahun itu pernah juga memiliki situs dan profil Tinder sendiri, tetapi pasangan Australia ini mengatakan mereka harus menutupnya karena mengelola respon dan surat penggemar mengubah aski yang awalnya lelucon ini menjadi pekerjaan penuh waktu.
Diklaim tak ada konten berbahaya


Cheeseburger dan kentang goreng McDonald’s terakhir di Eslandia ditampilkan dalam wadah kaca. AFP: Angelika Osiewalska

Waralaba asal Amerika ini menutup tiga cabangnya di Islandia selama krisis keuangan negara pulau itu pada tahun 2009, menjadikannya satu-satunya negara Barat tanpa gerai McDonald's.
Tepat sebelum penutupan restoran itu, Hjortur Smarason membeli cheeseburger untuk disimpan.
"Saya memutuskan untuk membeli burger terakhir demi nilai historisnya sejak McDonald's tutup," kata Smarason, yang bekerja sebagai manajer komunikasi.
"Saya pernah mendengar bahwa (burger) McDonald's tak pernah membusuk jadi saya hanya ingin melihat apakah itu benar atau tidak."
Ia pertama kali menyimpan burger itu di garasinya tetapi kemudian meminjamkannya ke Museum Nasional Islandia, setelah itu dipindahkan ke sebuah hotel di ibukota Reykjavik untuk sementara waktu.
"Orang-orang dari seluruh dunia ... datang ke sini hanya untuk mengunjungi burger itu," kata Sigurdur Gylfason, pemilik perusahaan itu.
Menyinggung klaim umum bahwa burgernya kebal terhadap pembusukan, McDonald's mengatakan pada tahun 2013 bahwa "di lingkungan yang tepat, burger mereka, seperti kebanyakan makanan lainnya, bisa terurai, dan" menambahkan bahwa "kelembaban khusus" diperlukan.
Dengan pengeringan yang cukup, mereka "tak mungkin menumbuhkan jamur atau bakteri atau membusuk", kata waralaba makanan cepat saji itu.
Bjorn Adalbjornsson, seorang dosen senior di fakultas ilmu makanan Universitas Islandia, mengatakan tanpa uap air, "makanan hanya akan mengering".
Tim Crowe, seorang ilmuwan nutrisi Australia dan ahli diet yang terakreditasi, mengatakan bahwa kandungan garam yang tinggi yang membuat burger McDonald's, khususnya, tahan terhadap pembusukan.
"Tak ada yang berbahaya tentang kandungan makanan McDonald's di sini," katanya kepada ABC.
"Ini hanyalah masalah kelembaban rendah dan kadar garam yang tinggi dari makanan itu."


Burger ini disimpan dalam kotak lardus yang dikunci. Supplied; Cassey Dean

Dr Crowe mengatakan makanan telah diawetkan dengan cara ini selama ribuan tahun, seraya mengutip buah kering sebagai contoh klasiknya.
"Ada banyak pilihan makanan yang lebih baik untuk nutrisi mereka daripada burger dan kentang goreng cepat saji, tetapi tak ada yang perlu dikhawatirkan tentang makanan seperti itu yang bertahan dalam ujian waktu dan tetap terpelihara dengan baik."
Menurut situs McDonald's, burger quarter pounder yang mereka produksi sekarang mengandung 29,2 gram lemak, 7,9 gram gula, dan 1.080 miligram natrium.
Dr Crowe mengatakan penyimpanan yang baik juga membantu memelihara makanan.
Setelah burger itu awalnya dikunci dalam kotak kardus untuk menghentikan ibu mereka mencoba membuangnya, Dean menggambarkan "penyimpanan khusus" 10 tahun berikutnya.
"Ia ada di dalam sebuah kotak di dalam kantong sampah yang penuh dengan pakaian yang baru saja dibuang ke belakang gudang," tuturnya sambil menambahkan bahwa "bahkan tikus pun tak melihatnya sebagai makanan".
"Tikus-tikus makan melalui kantong sampah, melalui pakaian, melalui kotak dan sampai ke burger dan mereka meninggalkannya."
Dean menambahkan bahwa ia tak lagi makan burger McDonald's.
Tahan lama
Pada bulan Februari, burger senior itu akan berusia 25 tahun.
"Burger quarter pounder kami akan berusia seperempat abad," kata Dean. "Rasanya masih seperti kemarin - mereka tumbuh sangat cepat."
"Kami mungkin akan mengambil topi kecil dan membawanya ke Maccas (McDonald's Australia) untuk pesta anak-anak."
Sejak meluncurkan akun Facebook itu, Dean dan Nits mengatakan para penggemar telah mengirim "karya seni penggemar". Museum burger telah mencoba untuk membelinya dan permintaan wawancara media telah datang dari seluruh dunia.
"Saya cukup yakin burger ini adalah hal yang paling mahal di rumah saya," kata Dean.
Pasangan teman itu mengatakan burger juga memainkan peran sebagai alat pendidikan anti-makanan cepat saji bagi ibunda Nits, yang merupakan seorang guru sekolah.
Dean - seorang musisi, sutradara musik dan pengemudi Uber paruh waktu -masih menggunakannya untuk menakut-nakuti penumpangnya yang masih muda yang membeli burger McDonald's larut malam.
Ia memperkirakan tingkat keberhasilan strateginya 60 persen.

text:
Australians Save McDonald's Burgers for Almost 25 Years and Remain Whole
05 Nov 2019, 06:31 by ABC
McDonald's oldest burger record is no longer held by Iceland. Two men from Australia claim to have a fast food franchise burger that is almost over a quarter of a century.
Main Points of Burger McD
The main point
• The quarter pounder burger has its own Facebook page and has had a Tinder profile
• McDonald's closed three of its branches in Iceland in 2009, making it the only Western country without a McDonald's outlet
• Nutritionists say high salt content and low humidity in the atmosphere can prevent spoilage
The burger, which is on display in glass as "McDonald's last cheeseburger sold in Iceland" - became an internet sensation as it celebrated its 10th birthday on Friday (11/01/2019).
Thousands of netizens have followed the aging process of this burger, while many tourists pose for selfies with this burger and fries that are displayed like works of art in glass containers at the Snotra House hostel in Iceland.
Not a bad record, but apparently a much older record in Australia. Australians, Casey Dean and Eduard Nits, said they still have a quarter pounder burger that will be 25 years old.
"I think they will have a hard time catching up with the age of our burgers, but I hope they succeed," Dean said when asked about the Icelandic burger.

External Link:
Took the little guy out for some fresh air today ... and for an interview in front of 113 million Russian viewers.

In 1995, the two friends bought burgers at one of McDonald's outlets in Adelaide.


Casey Dean and Eduard Nits bought quarter pounds when they were teenagers. Supplied; Cassey Dean

Fast food was something the 14-year-old children rarely ate, so Dean said they were buying "McDonald's burgers in ridiculous amounts because we could buy them."
With one burger left, a friend from another state who was about to come to visit said, "Keep the burger for me until I return".
"He never returned so we still have the burger," Dean, the owner of the burger for decades, told ABC.


Dean and Nits said initially their actions were just a joke. Supplied; Cassey Dean

What began as a personal joke, and something to "surprise" their friends, became famous throughout the world in 2015 after the pair of friends found the burger, which turned out to be stored behind the Nits sister's warehouse, with an appearance that was still an exact match like 20 years before.
"It's rock-hard," Dean said, adding that the bruger never smelled at all.
"It still looks the same but it's like a brick. You can subvert someone with it."
Now known as "senior burgers", this fast food has its own Facebook account called 'Can 20-Year-Old Burgers Get More Likes Than Kanye West?' and a song called 'Free the Burger' which contains the burger itself.
The nearly 25-year-old burger once also had his own Tinder site and profile, but the Australian couple said they had to shut it down because they were managing responses and fan letters turned the aski that originally made this joke into a full-time job.
Claimed no dangerous content


The last Cheeseburger and McDonald's fries in Iceland are displayed in glass containers. AFP: Angelika Osiewalska

The American franchise closed three of its branches in Iceland during the island nation's financial crisis in 2009, making it the only Western country without a McDonald's outlet.
Just before the restaurant closed, Hjortur Smarason bought a cheeseburger to store.
"I decided to buy the last burger for its historical value since McDonald's closed," said Smarason, who works as a communications manager.
"I've heard that (burgers) McDonald's never rot so I just want to see whether it's true or not."
He first kept the burger in his garage but then lent it to the Icelandic National Museum, after which it was moved to a hotel in the capital Reykjavik for a while.
"People from all over the world ... come here just to visit the burger," said Sigurdur Gylfason, owner of the company.
Alluding to the general claim that their burgers are immune to spoilage, McDonald's said in 2013 that "in the right environment, their burgers, like most other foods, can decompose, and" add that "special moisture" is needed.
With enough drying, they "cannot possibly grow mold or bacteria or rot," the fast food franchise said.
Bjorn Adalbjornsson, a senior lecturer at the University of Iceland's food science faculty, said without water vapor, "food will only dry up".
Tim Crowe, an Australian nutrition scientist and accredited dietitian, said that the high salt content that makes McDonald's burgers, in particular, is resistant to spoilage.
"There's nothing dangerous about McDonald's food content here," he told ABC.
"It's just a matter of low humidity and high salt levels from that food."


This burger is stored in a locked lardus box. Supplied; Cassey Dean

Dr Crowe said food has been preserved this way for thousands of years, citing dried fruit as a classic example.
"There are many better food choices for their nutrition than burgers and fast food fries, but there is nothing to worry about such foods that stand the test of time and remain well-maintained."
According to the McDonald's website, the quarter pounder burger they produce now contains 29.2 grams of fat, 7.9 grams of sugar, and 1,080 milligrams of sodium.
Dr Crowe said good storage also helps maintain food.
After the burger was initially locked in a cardboard box to stop their mother trying to dispose of it, Dean described the "special storage" the next 10 years.
"He was in a box in a garbage bag full of clothes that had just been thrown behind the barn," he said, adding that "even mice don't see it as food".
"Rats eat through garbage bags, through clothes, through boxes and get to burgers and they leave it."
Dean added that he no longer eats McDonald's burgers.
Durable
In February, the senior burger will be 25 years old.
"Our quarter pound burger will be a quarter of a century old," Dean said. "It still feels like yesterday - they grow very fast."
"We might take a small hat and bring it to Maccas (McDonald's Australia) for a children's party."
Since launching the Facebook account, Dean and Nits say fans have sent "fan artwork". The burger museum has tried to buy it and requests for media interviews have come from all over the world.
"I'm pretty sure this burger is the most expensive thing in my house," Dean said.
The friend's partner said the burger also played the role of an anti-fast food education tool for Nits' mother, who was a school teacher.
Dean - a musician, music director and part-time Uber driver - still uses it to frighten young passengers who buy McDonald's burgers late at night.
He estimated the success rate of his strategy at 60 percent.
